hero.title: Discover Your
hero.subtitle: Find your life's purpose and ideal career path
hero.description: Uncover your life's purpose through the ancient Japanese concept of Ikigai. Take our free Ikigai test to discover what is Ikigai and find the intersection of what you love, what you're good at, what the world needs, and what you can be paid for.

whatIsIkigai.title: What is Ikigai?
whatIsIkigai.description: Ever feel like you're just going through the motions? Ikigai combines "iki" (life) and "gai" (value) – your reason for being. It's not about climbing Everest or solving global issues. As neuroscientist Ken Mogi puts it: "Ikigai can be small. It can be the joy of your morning routine."
whatIsIkigai.passionDesc: Your passion – the things that light you up and make time fly. It could be painting, coaching, solving problems, or planting tomatoes. If it brings you joy, it belongs here.
whatIsIkigai.missionDesc: Where meaning deepens. About contribution – offering something that matters to others, whether it's support, service, creativity, or innovation.
whatIsIkigai.professionDesc: Natural talents or skills you've honed over time. It's not about being perfect; it's about recognizing where you shine and feel confident.
whatIsIkigai.vocation: What You Can Be Paid For
whatIsIkigai.vocationDesc: Finding a way to turn your passion and skills into something that can support you. If it pays the bills and fuels your purpose, you're on the right track.

howItWorks.description: Get your personalized Ikigai insights in just three simple steps.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about the Ikigai assessment
faq.q1: How long does the test take?
faq.a1: The Ikigai test typically takes 5-10 minutes to complete. There are 18 questions, and you can take your time to reflect on each one.
faq.a2: Yes, our Ikigai test is based on established psychological principles and the authentic Japanese concept of Ikigai. The questions are designed to evaluate the four core dimensions that contribute to life satisfaction and career fulfillment.
faq.q3: What's the difference between free and premium results?
faq.a3: Free results include your Ikigai profile, personality type, core strengths, and basic career recommendations. Premium features add detailed career roadmaps, interview preparation, personality deep dives, and 90-day transformation plans.
faq.a4: Yes, you can retake the test at any time. Each assessment will give you new insights about your personal and professional development.

whyIkigaiMatters.title: Why Ikigai Matters
whyIkigaiMatters.description: Embracing ikigai isn't just philosophical—it has real benefits backed by science.

stats.title: Lower mortality risk
stats.description: People with ikigai had significantly lower risk of death from cardiovascular disease

stats.title: Lower dementia risk
stats.description: Adults with ikigai showed better cognitive function and reduced dementia risk

stats.title: Lower disability risk
stats.description: Having ikigai protects against functional disability as we age

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about the Ikigai test.
faq.q1: How long does the test take?
faq.a1: The Ikigai test typically takes 5-10 minutes to complete. There are 18 questions, and you can take your time to reflect on each one.
faq.a2: Yes, our Ikigai test is based on established psychological principles and the authentic Japanese concept of Ikigai. The questions are designed to evaluate the four core dimensions that contribute to life satisfaction and career fulfillment.
faq.q3: What's the difference between free and premium results?
faq.a3: Free results include your Ikigai profile, personality type, core strengths, and basic career recommendations. Premium features add detailed career roadmaps, interview preparation, personality deep dives, and 90-day transformation plans.
faq.a4: Yes, you can retake the test at any time. We recommend waiting at least 3-6 months between Ikigai tests to allow for personal growth and changes in your circumstances.
